patterns: i want to know about mucormycosis
What do you know about mucormycosis?
responses: Mucormycosis is a serious infection and needs to be treated with prescription antifungal medicine, usually amphotericin B, posaconazole, or isavuconazole. These medicines are given through a vein (amphotericin B, posaconazole, isavuconazole) or by mouth (posaconazole, isavuconazole).

patterns: i want to know about mrsa
What do you know about mrsa?
responses: 1. Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) infection is caused by a type of staph bacteria that's become resistant to many of the antibiotics used to treat ordinary staph infections.2. Treatment of MRSA at home usually includes a 7- to 10-day course of an antibiotic (by mouth) such as trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole (brand name: Bactrim), clindamycin, minocycline, linezolid, or doxycycline.

patterns: i want to know about chickenpox
What do you know about chickenpox?
responses: 1. An infectious disease causing a mild fever and a rash of itchy inflamed pimples which turn to blisters and then loose scabs. It is caused by the herpes zoster virus and mainly affects children.2. If you or your child are at high risk of complications, your doctor may suggest an antiviral drug such as acyclovir (Zovirax, Sitavig). This medication might lessen the severity of chickenpox when given within 24 hours after the rash first appears.

patterns: i want to know about monkeypox
What do you know about monkeypox?
responses: 1. A viral disease affecting rodents and primates in rainforest areas of west and central Africa, related to smallpox and sometimes transmitted to humans.2. At this time, there are no specific treatments available for monkeypox infection, but monkeypox outbreaks can be controlled. Smallpox vaccine, cidofovir, ST-246, and vaccinia immune globulin (VIG) can be used to control a monkeypox outbreak.

patterns: i want to know about fungal meningitis
What do you know about fungal meningitis?
responses: 1.Fungal meningitis is a rare type of meningitis. It stems from a fungal infection reaching the brain and spinal cord. It primarily affects people with weakened immune systems. 2. Doctors treat fungal meningitis with long courses of high-dose antifungal medications, often given directly into a vein through an IV. After that, patients also need to take antifungal medications by mouth. The total length of treatment depends on the patients immune system and the type of fungus causing the infection.

patterns: i want to know about ear infection
What do you know about ear infection?
responses: 1. An ear infection occurs when a bacterial or viral infection affects the middle ear.2. Pain relievers:Children younger than 6 months: only give acetaminophen.Children 6 months or older: it is OK to give acetaminophen or ibuprofen.Never give aspirin to children because it can cause Reye√¢s syndrome, a rare but very serious illness that harms the liver and brain.

patterns: i want to know about conjunctivitis
What do you know about conjunctivitis?
responses: 1. Pink eye, also called conjunctivitis, is a infection of the eye's conjunctiva usually caused by a bacteria or virus.2. Antibiotic eye drops or ointments: To treat bacterial infections.Chloramphenicol, Moxifloxacin/Ciprofloxacin

patterns: i want to know about chickungunya
What do you know about chickungunya?
responses: 1. Chikungunya virus is spread to people by the bite of an infected mosquito. The most common symptoms of infection are fever and joint pain.2. There is no vaccine to prevent or medicine to treat chikungunya virus.If you are taking medicine for another medical condition, talk to your healthcare provider before taking additional medication.

patterns: i want to know about ringworm
What do you know about ringworm?
responses: 1. A contagious itching skin disease occurring in small circular patches, caused by any of a number of fungi and affecting chiefly the scalp or the feet.2. There are many non-prescription products available to treat ringworm, including:Clotrimazole (Lotrimin, Mycelex)

patterns: i want to know about diphtheria
What do you know about diphtheria?
responses: 1. An acute and highly contagious bacterial disease causing inflammation of the mucous membranes, formation of a false membrane in the throat which hinders breathing and swallowing, and potentially fatal heart and nerve damage by a bacterial toxin in the blood.2. Using diphtheria antitoxin to stop the toxin made by the bacteria from damaging the body. This treatment is very important for respiratory diphtheria infections, but it is rarely used for diphtheria skin infections.Using antibiotics to kill and get rid of the bacteria. This is important for both diphtheria infections in the respiratory system and on the skin.Tetanus-diphtheria-acellular pertussis(tdap), erythromycin, clyndamycin are some of the antibiotics and vaccines to prevent and treat diphtheria .

What do you know about dengue?
responses: 1. Dengue viruses are spread to people through the bite of an infected Aedes species mosquito.2. Rest as much as possible.Take acetaminophen (also known as paracetamol) to control fever and relieve pain only if prescribed by doctor.Do not take aspirin or ibuprofen!Severe dengue is a medical emergency. It requires immediate medical care at a clinic or hospital.
